value: // AJPS Additional Tables

// Analytical Packages:

// All packages can be directly installed from the STATA console using "findit [package name]" or "ssc install [package name]"
// 		ESTOUT can be downloaded directly from  http://repec.org/bocode/e/estout/
// 		RD can be downloaded directly from http://ideas.repec.org/c/boc/bocode/s456888.html
//Find and install packages used
//Regression discontinuity package
//Regression discontinuity package
//Output and display package
//Load KALAHI reelection dataset
//X.1 Adjusted sample for KALAHI and mayor reelection prior to disbursement of funds: removing municipalities that *possibly* might have disbursement before elections
//Data coded by comparing World Bank dataset to project documents on paper
//Specify control variables (basevars = excluding political and competitiveness variables)

options.value: "KALAHI and Mayor Reelection Prior to Disbursement of Funds (Adj)"

"Dependent variable is the reelection of incumbent mayor or relative. Logistic regression with province fixed effects and exponentiated coefficients (odds ratios). Standard errors, clustered by province, in parentheses. * p < 0.05, ** p < .01, *** p < .001"

value: //X.2 Comparing only provinces in which disbursement was given before the elections (i.e. not just announcement)

options.value: "Dependent variable is the reelection of incumbent mayor or relative. Logistic regression with province fixed effects and exponentiated coefficients (odds ratios). Standard errors, clustered by province, in parentheses. * p < 0.05, ** p < .01, *** p < .001"

value: //X.3 Robustness to excluding pilot sites and areas where mistakes may have been made in ranking/allocation (same sample used for RDD histogram and robustness check)
//Note that model 3 is significant only at 10% level
//Dropping pilot sites
//Dropping ranking errors
//Hingyon was ranked wealthy but it's a 5th class municipality
//There is a Garcia-Hernandez and a Pres. Garcia municipality that appears to have been switched
//Two possible duplicate observations in Davao
//Dropping pilot provinces/unsure rollout/original project documents unavailable

options.value: "Dependent variable is the reelection of incumbent mayor or relative. Logistic regression with province fixed effects and exponentiated coefficients (odds ratios). Standard errors, clustered by province, in parentheses. * p < 0.05, ** p < .01, *** p < .001"

value: //X.4 RDD results are robust to using the sample excluding pilot sites and ranking errors (same sample used in the histogram)
//Removes observations without ranking data
//Dropping pilot sites
//Dropping ranking errors
//Hingyon was ranked wealthy but it's a 5th class municipality
//There is a Garcia-Hernandez and a Pres. Garcia municipality that appears to have been switched

//graph noscatter

options.value: "Regression Discontinuity: KALAHI Participation and Incumbent Reelection in 2007"
"Dependent variable is the reelection of incumbent mayor or relative. Exponentiated coefficients displayed for consistency. * p < 0.05"
